user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of reply_with_method_not_supported:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
reply_with_method_not_supported (struct MHD_Connection *c)
{
  static const char page_content[] =
    "<html><head><title>Requested HTTP Method Is Not Supported</title></head>" \
    "<body>The requested HTTP method is not supported.</body></html>";
  static const size_t page_content_len =
    (sizeof(page_content) / sizeof(char)) - 1;
  struct MHD_Response *resp;
  enum MHD_Result ret;

  resp = MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (page_content_len, page_content)
  ;
  if (NULL == resp)
    return MHD_NO;

  /* Ignore possible error when adding the header as the reply will work even
     without this header. */
  (void) MHD_add_response_header (resp,
                                  MHD_HTTP_HEADER_CONTENT_TYPE, "text/html");

  ret = MHD_queue_response (c, MHD_HTTP_NOT_IMPLEMENTED, resp);
  MHD_destroy_response (resp);
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
I found no occurrences of compiler-specific language extensions in the provided function. Specifically:
- There are no GCC/Clang/MSVC extension tokens (no __attribute__, __extension__, __asm__, __builtin_*, typeof, __typeof__, statement-expression ({ ... }), or other vendor-specific keywords).
- The backslash used between the two string literal pieces is a standard C line-continuation/concatenation mechanism and not a compiler extension. Adjacent string literal concatenation and backslash-newline removal are standard behavior.
- The (void) cast to ignore a return value, static storage, enum usage, sizeof, and pointer usage are all standard C constructs.
- The odd formatting (a semicolon placed on the next line) is purely stylistic and not an extension.

One caveat: the MHD_* identifiers (functions/macros) come from an external library; if any of those macros expand to compiler-specific extensions, that would be visible only in their definitions (not in this snippet). Based solely on the code shown, there are no explicit compiler-language extensions to report.
